law.catch_line: Superintendents And Clerks; Appointment; Sign Indicating Location Of Office
law.text: [ Text of section effective until March 27, 2011. Repealed by 2011, 3, Sec. 131.] The commissioner shall appoint for each of the offices provided for in the preceding section a superintendent who shall, under the direction of the commissioner, perform the duties hereinafter set forth or such as he may require. The commissioner may also appoint an assistant superintendent and such clerks as he may deem necessary for the proper conduct of the business of said employment offices. The location of each office established under the preceding section shall be plainly indicated by a proper sign.
